arts.ttl: Hull City handed major Christmas boost after ending long winless Championship run against Swansea
arts.sum: Their deserved victory over the Swans thanks to a goal in each half from Joao Pedro and Mason Burstow elevated Ruben Selles' side out of the drop zone and a point clear of the bottom three, helped in part to comprehensive defeats for Cardiff City and Oxford United, while Plymouth Argyle's thrilling 3-3 draw at home to Middlesbrough saw the Pilgrims drop to the foot. Sheffield United extended their unbeaten Championship run to 11 games to with a comfortable 2-0 win at struggling Cardiff City, to stay three points clear on a day when all of the divisionâ€™s top four sides recorded victories.

arts.ttl: 'Powerful feeling' Ruben Selles delighted as Hull City win gives manager his wish
arts.sum: Just as they had done in Selles' previous two games, the Tigers conceded an equaliser inside ten minutes, Selles could be forgiven for thinking it would be a familiar tale of frustration, but he says he knows why it happened and how it can be corrected. Despite a flurry of second half chances, it looked liked the Tigers would again be frustrated and be forced to wait until next year for a home success, when Burstow angled in a delicious curling effort to send the MKM Stadium delirious, and see Selles celebrating a huge win with the players, and supporters at the end.

arts.ttl: Hull beat Swansea as Selles claims first win
arts.sum: Mason Burstow's 80th-minute strike earned Hull a 2-1 win at home to Swansea to end a 13-match run without victory.

arts.ttl: Hull City 2-1 Swansea City: Off-colour Swans slip to poor defeat on Humberside
arts.sum: Swansea were made to pay for a poor performance at the MKM Stadium

arts.ttl: Substitute Mason Burstow scores winner as Hull beat Swansea to end 13-match run
arts.sum: Hull earned just a fourth home win in the calendar year.

arts.ttl: Mason Burstow inspires Hull City's first win in 14 games as Selles era takes off
arts.sum: City deservedly hit the front just after the half-hour when Joao Pedro forced in at the near post, but missed chances were costly, as was their inability to keep the lead, with Harry Darling heading in just eight minutes later from a rare Swans attack after ex-Tiger Josh Tymon picked him out well. The chance Selles and the supporters craved came 16 minutes in when Giles' cross from the left found Slater six yards out unmarked, but the midfielder somehow sliced wide instead of hitting the back of the net, and so went a gilt-edged opening the goal-shy Tigers could ill-afford to pass up.

arts.ttl: Hull City v Swansea City Live: Kick-off time, team news and score updates
arts.sum: Follow live updates as Swansea City travel to Hull

arts.ttl: Ruben Selles sets Hull City squad new challenge as the Tigers prepare to face Swansea City
arts.sum: Ruben Selles says it's time his Hull City side made a statement by beating Swansea City to break the cycle of negativity which has engulfed the struggling Tigers this season. And Selles is determined to try and break the cycle of doom in the final home outing before Christmas and of what has been a dismal 2024 in front of their own supporters with only three wins in the calendar year.

arts.ttl: Swansea City boss doubles down on criticism of players ahead of Hull City trip
arts.sum: "If you look at the league table, I think we've lost seven against the top 10," the former Notts County boss said . Despite his comments, the Swans have won two of their last three games on the road, beating Plymouth Argyle and Derby County.

arts.ttl: Don Goodman offers Hull City assessment ahead of vital Swansea clash
arts.sum: But reality bit on Saturday when another winning position was passed up by the Tigers to lose 2-1 at Coventry City, resurgent under Frank Lampard. "Despite Hull City winning just one game in 13, it's not easy for me to go for a Swansea win.
